intro: Pycnostelma chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese thornapple, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are round, fleshy berries that turn red when mature. Pycnostelma chinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
